Message.Msg: Yes Bernanke and the fed owns this stock, look at the 10 yr treasury today over 2.4 percent, and thats state and local tax free, thats your price on T, only reason to buy this stock is for the divvy and that is not looking too good anymore,, Its not only T look at all high divvy stocks, but T has the problem of no revenue growth, I think the divvy will go back to 6 percent and that means the price goes back below 30,,,,

Message.Title: T and interest rates
Message.Msg: How high do rates have to go where you will be able to beat the 5% dividend.?? My guess it will take years not months. Why bail. T will not be cutting their dividend.

Not really dont forget treasuries are state and local tax free, where stock dividends arent, also the safety factor, do you want to say buy T at 35 at 5 percent then see the value go to 30 then it takes 5 years of divvys just to break even,,,,, its called the safety factor...
Interesting

Told you all so. I'm no genius - just been doing this for a LONG time. Bernanke drops this below $35 all by himself just like I said. And this is with positive momentum running up to its ex-div. After ex-div below $33. After another nasty earnings - dips below $30. At that point it will yield over 6% and that MAY save it from significant further erosion - or mayby not. This market will be in turmoil and T will be hit much harder than most for reasons I don't have time to get into with you plebes. Sorry Beau - you were probably the only person in the world that paid $39 for T. Save those divs while you still can (or cut your losses NOW). Please doubt the great Osso at your own peril. Cheers. Osso Very Very Very Strong Sell
Soon you can get 6%. Real soon. Osso

Message.Title: Not much institutional action
Message.Msg: Don't buy until the institutions do. They know a bargain when they see one. They are not panicking so hang in if you are long. Even though volume is running about 150% of average volume it looks like the day traders are all loaded up and we are ready to start back up. Beware of the last hour today when the profit taking will likely create another panic like sell off.

Oh my oh my Wilkes - but you are correct about the last hour carnage coming however it won't be after "starting back up" - LOL. The last hour will just take this day from horrendous to window jumping time (and tomorrow, Friday, will be worse ). There won't be any late profit taking from anything that happens today. Maybe profit taking from people that got in under $30 but that will just kill T more - and weaken it for a LONG time. T stock is in the worse spot it's been for quite some years. This is going to be a disaster. Sorry Beau! Osso

Message.Title: Yankee stay home!
Message.Msg: From the management that lost shareholders $4 billion foolishly chasing TMobile, now T's going to try to acquire a minority share in Telefonica? Be serious. Foreign regulators would suck every dime out of T's overseas investment. Just look at how Vodafone's being crippled in its foreign operations. Southern Europen economies are a basket case. They will make T's Apple subsidies look frugal. I bought T for dividends and stability not wild speculation. Mind your own U.S. business.
